author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: غَنِيًّا عَنْ دُونِكَ وَمُسْتَغْنِيًا عَمَّا سِواكَ، ثُمَّ أَنْزِلْ عَلَيَّ مِنْ سَحَابِ جُودِكَ ما يَنْفَعُنِي فِيْ كُلِّ عالَمٍ مِنْ عَوالِمِكَ، ثُمَّ وَفِّقْنِيْ عَلَى خِدْمَةِ أَمْرِك بَيْنَ عِبادِكَ عَلَى شَأْنٍ يَظْهَرُ مِنِّيْ ما يَثْبُتُ بِهِ ذِكْريْ بِدَوامِ مَلَكُوتِكَ وَجَبَرُوتكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ هذا عَبْدُكَ
translation: I beseech Thee so to enrich me as to dispense with all save Thee, and be made independent of any one except Thyself. Rain down, then, upon me out of the clouds of Thy bounty that which shall profit me in every world of Thy worlds. Assist me, then, through Thy strengthening grace, so to serve Thy Cause amidst Thy servants that I may show forth what will cause me to be remembered as long as Thine own kingdom endureth and Thy dominion will last.
